metadata.Title: CVE-2018-3693 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
Systems with microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and branch prediction may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a speculative buffer overflow and side-channel analysis.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3693` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

intel-microcode - 3.20180312.0~ubuntu16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-112-generic - 4.4.0-112.135

notes.Note: tyhicks> Also known as "Bounds Check Bypass Store" This issue is mitigated using the same techniques as CVE-2017-5753. Ubuntu and the rest of the Linux kernel community will continue to monitor for vulnerable instances in the kernel and insert speculation barriers, as needed.

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
intel-microcode package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20180312.0~ubuntu16.04.1').
linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-112.135').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1049.58').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-euclid package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-9023.24').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
